Dear Mr. Hawkins:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Repeat violations require an explanation on why the previous corrective
action plan was not successful.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (616) 552-3662.

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Facility admitted youth and administered psychotropic medication Yes
without parental consent.
III. METHODOLOGY
12/15/2020 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0223010
12/15/2020 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
Telephone call with Director of Quality and Risk
12/16/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
Interview and discussion investigation and reviewed requirements
12/16/2020 Exit Conference
Discussed findings with Director Quality and Risk.
ALLEGATION:
Facility admitted youth and administered psychotropic medication without parental
consent.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed the Director of Quality and Risk on December 11, 2020 after being
contacted by her with concerns of an informed consent. Director of Quality and Risk
reported Youth A was admitted on November 30, 2020 after hours. He is prescribed
three psychotropic medications, but the foster care worker did not provide the
informed consent upon admission. The foster care worker agreed to provide the
admission paperwork the following day but has not done so. St. John’s home has
been administering all three psychotropic medications to Youth A since admission
without an informed consent on file. Director of Quality and Risk acknowledged the
facility should not have admitted and/or administered Youth A the psychotropic
medication without the informed consent. Director of Quality and Risk was seeking
consultation on how to move forward to rectify the issue in the safest way possible
as the medication should not be discontinued abruptly but titrated off. Director of
Quality and Risk had already contacted the foster care agency and contractor to
discuss obtaining consent immediately or the medication would need to be
discontinued.
I reviewed Youth A’s MiSACWIS case record. He entered care on October 22,
2020. He was admitted to St. John’s Home on November 30, 2020. In review of the
case record Youth A is prescribed three psychotropic medications and there are no
informed consents located in the case file.
2

APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 802-1 PSYCHOTROPIC MEDICATION IN FOSTER CARE
Consent is required for the prescription and use of all
psychotropic medications for all children in foster care and
for children placed for adoption where the court has not
issued an order finalizing the adoption.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as they administered
medication to Youth A without an informed consent.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan; no changes
be made to the status of the license of this child caring institution.
